3 Little Pigs.自分の家を建てようとした3匹の子豚がいました: There were three little pigs who tried to build their own house
3 Little Pigs.一匹目の子豚はわらの家を建て: The first piglet built a straw house,
3 Little Pigs.二匹目の子豚は棒の家を建て: The second piglet built a stick house.
3 Little Pigs.三匹目の子豚はレンガの家を建てました: The third piglet built a brick house
3 Little Pigs.大きな悪いオオカミが最初の子豚の家にやってきました: A big bad wolf came to the house of the first piglet
3 Little Pigs.二匹目のブタの家まで全速力で走りました: I ran at full speed to the house of the second pig
3 Little Pigs.オオカミは棒の家まで彼を追いかけました: The wolf followed him to the house of the stick
3 Little Pigs.レンガでできた三匹目の豚の家に走って行きました: I ran to the house of the third pig, which was made of bricks
3 Little Pigs.オオカミはレンガ造りの家を吹き飛ばそうとしましたが: Although the wolf tried to blow up the brick house
3 Little Pigs.3匹の子豚は無事で: The three piglets are safe and
3 Little Pigs.大きな悪いオオカミはやがて去っていきました: The big bad wolf eventually left
3 Little Pigs.努力と献身が最後に報われることを学びました: I've learned that hard work and dedication pay off in the end

The Magical Garden.小さな村に魔法の庭がありました: There was a magic garden in a small village
The Magical Garden.一年中色とりどりの花が咲き乱れ: Colorful flowers bloom all year round
The Magical Garden.木々が鳥たちに秘密をささやいていました: The trees were whispering secrets to the birds
The Magical Garden.何よりも不思議なのは: The strangest thing of all is
The Magical Garden.ロージーという名前のしゃべるウサギでした: It was a talking rabbit named Rosie
The Magical Garden.庭に来る人を助けるのが大好きでした: Loved helping people who came to the garden
The Magical Garden.ティミーという少年が庭を訪れました: A boy named Timmy visited the garden
The Magical Garden.ティミーはロージーにおもちゃをなくしたことを話した: Timmy told Rosie that he had lost his toy
The Magical Garden.大きくて光沢のある葉の下に隠されたおもちゃを見つけました: I found a toy hidden under a large, shiny leaf
The Magical Garden.ロージーの魔法の助けに感謝した: Thanked Rosie for her magical help
The Magical Garden.ティミーは魔法の庭を頻繁に訪れ: Timmy is a frequent visitor to the magical garden.
The Magical Garden.彼とロージーは親友になり: He and Rosie became best friends.
The Magical Garden.さらに多くの魔法の冒険を一緒に共有しました: We have shared many more magical adventures together

The Friendly Forest.リリーという女の子がいました: There was a girl named Lily
The Friendly Forest.彼女は家の近くの大きな森に行きました: She went to a large forest near her house
The Friendly Forest.彼女はトレイイという幸せな木に出会いました: She came across a happy tree named Trey
The Friendly Forest.トレイは笑みを浮かべていた: Trey had a smile on his face
The Friendly Forest.スクィーキーという名前の親切なリスにも出会いました: We also met a kind squirrel named Squeaky
The Friendly Forest.色とりどりでいい匂いがしました: It was colorful and smelled good
The Friendly Forest.フラッターという名前の人懐っこい蝶に与えました: I gave it to a friendly butterfly named Flutter
The Friendly Forest.澄んだ水が湧き出るきらめく小川が見えた: I could see a sparkling stream with clear water gushing out
The Friendly Forest.ピカピカの魚が生息していました: There were shiny fish living there
The Friendly Forest.リリーと彼女の新しい友達は小川のそばに座り: Lily and her new friends sit by the stream.
The Friendly Forest.穏やかな水の音を楽しみました: I enjoyed the gentle sound of the water
The Friendly Forest.家に帰る時間になると: When it's time to go home
The Friendly Forest.私の友達でいてくれてありがとう: Thank you for being my friend
The Friendly Forest.新しい友達に会えたことを嬉しく思いながら森を後にした: I left the forest happy to see my new friend

The Lost Kitten.エマという少女がいました: There was a girl named Emma
The Lost Kitten.裏庭で小さくてふわふわの子猫を見つけました: I found a small, fluffy kitten in my backyard
The Lost Kitten.エマは子猫のことを悲しくなり: Emma is sad about the kitten.
The Lost Kitten.エマはお母さんに子猫を飼ってもいいかと尋ね: Emma asks her mom if she can get a kitten
The Lost Kitten.エマとウィスカーズは親友になりました: Emma and Whiskers became best friends
The Lost Kitten.エマはウィスカーズにおいしいキャットフードを与え: Emma feeds Whiskers delicious cat food
The Lost Kitten.ウィスカーズは迷ったり怖がったりしなくなりました: Whiskers are no longer lost or scared
The Lost Kitten.エマと彼女の新しい毛むくじゃらの友達は一緒にとても幸せでした: Emma and her new furry friend were so happy together
The Lost Kitten.毎日お互いを笑顔にしました: We made each other smile every day

Goldilocks and the Three Bears.赤ちゃんクマの3匹のクマが住んでいた小さくて居心地の良いコテージがありました: There was a small and cozy cottage where three bears of baby bears lived
Goldilocks and the Three Bears.ママベアがおいしいお粥を作った後: After Mama Bear made delicious porridge
Goldilocks and the Three Bears.家族はお粥を冷やすために散歩に出かけました: The family went for a walk to cool the porridge
Goldilocks and the Three Bears.ゴルディロックスという好奇心旺盛な少女が彼らのコテージに偶然出くわしました: A curious girl named Goldilocks stumbled upon their cottage
Goldilocks and the Three Bears.ドアを押し開けて中に入りました: I pushed the door open and went inside

Goldilocks and the Three Bears.ママベアのお椀のお粥を味わって: Taste the porridge in Mama Bear's bowl
Goldilocks and the Three Bears.彼女はそれを全部食べてしまいました: She ended up eating it all
Goldilocks and the Three Bears.居間に3つの椅子を見つけました: I found 3 chairs in the living room
Goldilocks and the Three Bears.彼女はパパベアの大きな椅子に座りましたが: She sat in Papa Bear's big chair,
Goldilocks and the Three Bears.ママベアの中くらいの大きさの椅子も試してみたが: I also tried a medium-sized chair for Mama Bear.
Goldilocks and the Three Bears.それから赤ちゃん熊の小さな椅子に座り: Then sit on the little chair of the baby bear,
Goldilocks and the Three Bears.眠気に襲われて二階に上がると: When I went upstairs with drowsiness
Goldilocks and the Three Bears.娘はパパベアのベッドに横になりましたが: My daughter lay down on Papa Bear's bed,
Goldilocks and the Three Bears.彼女はママベアのベッドに移動しましたが: Although she moved to Mama Bear's bed
Goldilocks and the Three Bears.彼女は赤ちゃんクマのベッドを試しましたが: Although she tried a bed for a baby bear
Goldilocks and the Three Bears.3匹のクマが家に帰ると: When the three bears return home
Goldilocks and the Three Bears.コテージのドアが開いていてびっくりしました: I was surprised to see that the cottage door was open
Goldilocks and the Three Bears.最後に赤ちゃんクマのベッドで眠っている小さな女の子を見つけました: Finally found a little girl sleeping in a baby bear bed
Goldilocks and the Three Bears.できるだけ早くコテージを飛び出し: Jump out of the cottage as soon as possible

Cinderella.彼女は意地悪な継母と2人の義理の姉妹と一緒に住んでいましたが: Although she lived with a mean stepmother and two stepsisters
Cinderella.義理の妹は彼女を非常に粗末に扱いました: The sister-in-law treated her very poorly

Cinderella.王国のすべての若い女性を招待して: Inviting all the young women of the kingdom

Cinderella.カボチャを立派な馬車に変えました: Turned a pumpkin into a fine carriage
Cinderella.彼女はシンデレラにガラスのスリッパを渡し: She gives Cinderella a glass slipper,
Cinderella.真夜中に魔法が切れると警告しました: I warned you that the magic would break in the middle of the night

Cinderella.宮殿の階段でガラスのスリッパをなくしました: I lost my glass slippers on the steps of the palace
Cinderella.謎の少女を見つけようと決意した王子は: The prince is determined to find the mysterious girl.
Cinderella.ガラスのスリッパを使って王国を捜索しました: We used glass slippers to search the kingdom
Cinderella.彼がシンデレラの家に着いたとき: When he arrived at Cinderella's house
Cinderella.スリッパは彼女にぴったりでした: The slippers were perfect for her
Cinderella.王子は舞踏会から彼女を認識し: The prince recognized her from the ball,
Cinderella.シンデレラは継母と義理の姉妹の残酷さを許し: Cinderella forgives the cruelty of her stepmother and sister-in-law.
Cinderella.シンデレラの優しさと謙虚さは王国中に知られていました: Cinderella's kindness and humility were known throughout the kingdom

Jack and the Beanstalk.お金が必要だから牛を売るように言いました: I told him to sell the cow because he needed money
Jack and the Beanstalk.牛を売りに行く途中: On the way to sell cattle

Jack and the Beanstalk.母親に見せるために家に走った: I ran home to show my mother
Jack and the Beanstalk.豆を窓から投げ捨てました: I threw the beans out the window
Jack and the Beanstalk.ジャックは巨大な豆の木が空に伸びているのを見た: Jack saw a huge beanstalk stretching into the sky

Jack and the Beanstalk.巨人には金の卵を産む雌鶏と魔法のハープがありました: The giant had a hen that laid golden eggs and a magic harp
Jack and the Beanstalk.ジャックは巨人の家に忍び込み: Jack sneaks into the giant's house

Jack and the Beanstalk.ジャックは地面に着くと: When Jack gets to the ground

The Ugly Duckling.母ガモが卵の塊を持っていました: A mother duck was carrying a mass of eggs
The Ugly Duckling.卵の1つは他の卵よりも大きく: one of the eggs is larger than the other,
The Ugly Duckling.孵化するのはずっと後でした: It was much later to hatch
The Ugly Duckling.そこから出てきたのは: What came out of it was:
The Ugly Duckling.兄妹とは違う顔をしたアヒルの子でした: It was a duckling with a different face from his brother and sister
The Ugly Duckling.他の人たちのように黄色くて可愛くはありませんでした: It wasn't yellow and pretty like the others
The Ugly Duckling.他のアヒルの子は彼と遊ばず: Other ducklings do not play with him
The Ugly Duckling.醜いアヒルの子はとても悲しくなり: The ugly duckling becomes very sad
The Ugly Duckling.幸せになれる場所を見つけるために家を出ました: I left home to find a place where I could be happy
The Ugly Duckling.彼はさまざまな動物に会いましたが: Although he met a variety of animals
The Ugly Duckling.彼はとても大きくて灰色だったので: Because he was so big and gray
The Ugly Duckling.彼らは皆彼を不思議そうに見ました: They all looked at him curiously
The Ugly Duckling.醜いアヒルの子は湖を見つけて泳ぎました: The ugly duckling found the lake and swam
The Ugly Duckling.美しい白い鳥が頭上を飛んでいるのが見えました: I saw a beautiful white bird flying overhead
The Ugly Duckling.彼は彼らのように美しく優雅になりたいと願った: He wanted to be as beautiful and graceful as them
The Ugly Duckling.醜いアヒルの子は水に映る自分の姿を見ました: The ugly duckling saw his reflection in the water
The Ugly Duckling.彼はもはや灰色の厄介な鳥ではなかった: He was no longer a gray nasty bird
The Ugly Duckling.彼は美しい白鳥に変身していました: He was transforming into a beautiful swan
The Ugly Duckling.今や美しい白鳥になり: Now it is a beautiful swan,
The Ugly Duckling.自分が生まれたときの姿は関係ない: It doesn't matter what you look like when you were born
The Ugly Duckling.彼は素敵な白鳥に変身していたからだと学びました: I learned that it was because he had been transformed into a lovely swan

The Little Red Hen.農場に住んでいた小さな赤いめんどりがいました: There was a little red hen who lived on the farm
The Little Red Hen.彼女は地面に種を見つけた: She found seeds in the ground
The Little Red Hen.種が背の高い小麦に成長すると: When the seeds grow into tall wheat
The Little Red Hen.誰が小麦を刈るのを手伝ってくれるの: Who will help you reap wheat

The Little Red Hen.誰がパンを焼くのを手伝ってくれるの: Who will help you bake bread
The Little Red Hen.犬と猫とアヒルがやってきて: Dogs, cats and ducks are coming
The Little Red Hen.彼女はパンを食べてとても幸せでした: She was very happy to eat bread

The Tortoise and the Hare.自分がどれだけ速く走れるかを自慢するのが大好きな: I love to brag about how fast I can run
The Tortoise and the Hare.足の速いウサギがいました: There was a rabbit with fast legs
The Tortoise and the Hare.動きの遅い亀もいましたが: Although there was also a slow-moving turtle
The Tortoise and the Hare.ウサギは亀を笑って言いました: The rabbit laughed at the turtle and said
The Tortoise and the Hare.俺はお前よりずっと速く走れる: I can run much faster than you
The Tortoise and the Hare.どっちが速いか見てみよう: Let's see which one is faster
The Tortoise and the Hare.森の動物たちがみんな見物に来ました: All the animals in the forest came to see
The Tortoise and the Hare.カメはずっと後ろに残されました: The turtle was left all the way back
The Tortoise and the Hare.しばらく休むことができる: You can rest for a while
The Tortoise and the Hare.彼は木の下に横になって眠りに落ちました: He lay down under a tree and fell asleep
The Tortoise and the Hare.カメがフィニッシュラインの近くにいるのが見えました: I saw a turtle near the finish line
The Tortoise and the Hare.彼は全力で走ったが: Although he ran with all his might
The Tortoise and the Hare.亀が最初にフィニッシュラインを通過しました: The turtle was the first to cross the finish line
The Tortoise and the Hare.他人を自慢したり過小評価したりしてはならないことを学びました: I learned not to boast or underestimate others

Hansel and Gretel.ヘンゼルとグレーテルという2人の子供がいて: They have two children, Hansel and Gretel.
Hansel and Gretel.父親と意地悪な継母と一緒に住んでいました: He lived with his father and a mean stepmother
Hansel and Gretel.継母はみんなに十分な食べ物がなかったので: Because the stepmother did not have enough food for everyone
Hansel and Gretel.子供たちを森に残すことにしました: It was decided to leave the children in the forest
Hansel and Gretel.父親はやりたがらなかったが: Although the father did not want to do it

Hansel and Gretel.ヘンゼルとグレーテルは小石の道をたどり: Hansel and Gretel follow the path of pebbles
Hansel and Gretel.ヘンゼルとグレーテルは森の奥深くに連れて行かれました: Hansel and Gretel were taken deep into the forest
Hansel and Gretel.ヘンゼルはパンくずの痕跡を残しましたが: Although Hansel left traces of breadcrumbs
Hansel and Gretel.帰る道が見つかりませんでした: I couldn't find my way back
Hansel and Gretel.キャンディーでできた家を見つけ: Find a house made of candy
Hansel and Gretel.そこに住んでいた年老いた魔女が彼らを捕まえ: An old witch who lived there caught them,
Hansel and Gretel.彼女はグレーテルに家事をさせ: She let Gretel do the housework.
Hansel and Gretel.ヘンゼルを食べるつもりでした: I was going to eat Hansel
Hansel and Gretel.オーブンに押し込みました: I pressed it into the oven
Hansel and Gretel.彼らは魔女の家で宝物を見つけました: They found a treasure in the witch's house
Hansel and Gretel.ヘンゼルとグレーテルは宝物を持って家に帰る方法を見つけました: Hansel and Gretel found a way to return home with the treasure
Hansel and Gretel.彼らの父親は彼らを見て大喜びし: Their father was overjoyed to see them.
Hansel and Gretel.彼らを森に置き去りにしたことを後悔していると言いました: He said he regretted leaving them in the woods
Hansel and Gretel.意地悪な継母には二度と会うことはなかった: I never saw my mean stepmother again
Hansel and Gretel.たくさんの食べ物ともう心配することなく幸せに暮らしました: Lots of food and no more worries lived happily

The Emperor's New Clothes.派手な服を着るのが大好きな虚栄心の強い皇帝がいました: There was a vain emperor who loved to wear fancy clothes
The Emperor's New Clothes.彼は身なりを整えることにすべてのお金を費やしました: He spent all his money on dressing up

The Emperor's New Clothes.非常に愚かな人や仕事が苦手な人には見えないものだと彼らは主張しました: They argued that it was invisible to the very stupid or the bad at work
The Emperor's New Clothes.それは素晴らしい考えだと思いました: I thought that was a great idea
The Emperor's New Clothes.彼は彼らに金と絹を与えて服を作りました: He gave them gold and silk to make clothes
The Emperor's New Clothes.詐欺師たちは働くふりをしましたが: Although the scammers pretended to work
The Emperor's New Clothes.金と絹はすべて自分たちのために取っておきました: They set aside all the gold and silk for themselves
The Emperor's New Clothes.皇帝はそれらを見に行きました: The emperor went to see them
The Emperor's New Clothes.服は見当たらなかったが: I couldn't find any clothes, but
The Emperor's New Clothes.バカだと思われたくなかったので: I didn't want to be thought of as stupid.
The Emperor's New Clothes.皇帝に新しい服を着せるふりをしました: Pretended to dress the emperor in new clothes
The Emperor's New Clothes.天皇陛下は全国民の前でパレードを行いました: His Majesty the Emperor held a parade in front of the entire nation
The Emperor's New Clothes.愚か者と呼ばれるのが嫌だったので: Because I didn't want to be called a fool
The Emperor's New Clothes.服を見るふりをしました: I pretended to look at the clothes
The Emperor's New Clothes.皆が同じことを囁き始めた: Everyone started whispering the same thing
The Emperor's New Clothes.皇帝は自分たちが正しいことに気づいたが: Although the emperors realized that they were right,
The Emperor's New Clothes.自分の過ちを認めるにはあまりにも誇らしげで: Too proud to admit my mistakes

Sleeping Beauty.子供を欲しがる王様とお妃様がいました: There was a king and queen who wanted children

Sleeping Beauty.オーロラの誕生を祝うために: To celebrate the birth of the Northern Lights

Sleeping Beauty.呪いを和らげることはできた: I was able to soften the curse
Sleeping Beauty.真実の愛のキスだけが彼女を目覚めさせることができると言いました: I said that only a kiss of true love can wake her up
Sleeping Beauty.オーロラは美しく優しいお姫様に成長しました: Aurora has grown into a beautiful and gentle princess
Sleeping Beauty.糸車を見つけて指を刺してしまった: I found a spinning wheel and pricked my finger
Sleeping Beauty.娘は深い眠りに落ち: The daughter fell into a deep sleep.
Sleeping Beauty.王国中も一緒に眠りに落ちました: The whole kingdom fell asleep with them
Sleeping Beauty.一人の王子が王国にやって来ました: One prince came to the kingdom
Sleeping Beauty.オーロラと王国全体が目を覚ました: Aurora and the whole kingdom woke up
Sleeping Beauty.王子とオーロラは恋に落ち: Prince and Aurora fall in love
Sleeping Beauty.王国は再び喜びと笑いに満ちました: The kingdom was once again filled with joy and laughter

Amelia Earhart.イアハートという勇敢で冒険好きな女の子がいました: There was a brave and adventurous girl named Earhart
Amelia Earhart.鳥のように空高く舞い上がることを夢見ていました: I dreamed of soaring high in the sky like a bird
Amelia Earhart.彼女が育った時代は: The era in which she grew up
Amelia Earhart.パイロットになる女性はあまりいなかったが: There weren't many women who became pilots.
Amelia Earhart.アメリアは自分の夢を追うことを決意した: Amelia was determined to pursue her dream
Amelia Earhart.飛行機の操縦方法を学び: Learn how to fly an airplane
Amelia Earhart.世界初の女性パイロットの一人になりました: Became one of the world's first female pilots
Amelia Earhart.アメリアは本当に驚くべきことを成し遂げました: Amelia has accomplished something truly amazing

The Great Wall of China.中国の豊かな歴史と不朽の強さの象徴であり続けています: It continues to be a symbol of China's rich history and enduring strength
The Great Wall of China.世界の七不思議の1つとして認識されており: It is recognized as one of the Seven Wonders of the World.
The Great Wall of China.その壮大さと歴史的重要性に驚嘆するために世界中から何百万人もの人々が訪れています: It is visited by millions of people from all over the world to marvel at its grandeur and historical significance
